lead: The landscape of AI is rapidly evolving, with significant discussions around its ethical implications, technological advancements, and its impact on various industries.

stories.title: Hundreds of creatives warn against an AI slop future
stories.summary: A coalition of around 800 artists, writers, and musicians has launched a campaign titled 'Stealing Isn't Innovation,' protesting against AI companies for allegedly appropriating creative works without consent. Notable signatories include authors George Saunders and Jodi Picoult, along with actors and musicians. This movement highlights the growing concern over the ethical use of AI in creative fields and the potential dilution of human artistry.

stories.title: AI hasn't delivered the profits it was hyped for, says Deloitte
stories.summary: Deloitte's latest report reveals that many businesses have not seen the expected financial returns from their AI investments. The findings suggest a gap between AI's potential and its current performance in generating revenue, prompting companies to reassess their strategies for integrating AI into their operations. This raises questions about the sustainability of AI hype in the business sector.

stories.title: YouTube Will Soon Let Creators Make Shorts Using Their AI Likeness
stories.summary: YouTube is set to introduce a feature that allows creators to generate Shorts using AI representations of themselves. This move is part of a broader trend where platforms are integrating AI tools to enhance user creativity and engagement. YouTube's CEO emphasizes that AI will serve as a tool for expression rather than a replacement for human creativity.

stories.title: Apple plans to make Siri an AI chatbot, report says
stories.summary: Apple is reportedly transforming Siri into a more advanced AI chatbot, akin to ChatGPT. This evolution aims to enhance user interaction across Apple devices, making Siri more conversational and capable of handling complex queries. The anticipated changes reflect a significant shift in how voice assistants are expected to function in the future.

stories.title: AI networking startup Upscale scores $200M to challenge Nvidia's NVSwitch
stories.summary: Upscale, an AI networking startup, has secured $200 million in funding to compete with Nvidia's NVSwitch technology. This investment underscores the increasing demand for advanced networking solutions in AI applications, as companies seek to optimize data processing and machine learning capabilities. Upscale's innovative approach could reshape the competitive landscape of AI networking.

stories.title: OpenAI just unveiled its Google Translate competitor, and ChatGPT already wins in a big way
stories.summary: OpenAI has launched a new translation tool that competes directly with Google Translate, showcasing the capabilities of ChatGPT. Early reviews indicate that ChatGPT Translate outperforms its competitor in several key areas, highlighting the advancements in AI-driven language processing. This development could significantly impact how users approach translation tasks in the future.

stories.title: Future jobs in AI will come with a hardhat and boots, tech bigshots argue
stories.summary: Industry leaders predict that future jobs in AI will require hands-on skills, emphasizing the need for a workforce that can blend technical knowledge with practical application. This shift suggests that as AI technology evolves, so too will the nature of jobs created by it, moving beyond traditional roles to include more physically demanding positions.

stories.title: eBay updates legalese to ban AI-powered shop-bots
stories.summary: In a move to regulate the use of AI in online shopping, eBay has updated its policies to prohibit AI-powered shop-bots. This decision reflects growing concerns about the impact of AI on fair trading practices and consumer rights, as platforms seek to maintain a level playing field for all users.
